FOUND IN: Carbolic acid (phenol, historically used for its antiseptic properties)
Radium (also discovered with Pierre Curie and their daughter Irène Joliot-Curie in the same period as polonium).

The word "Polygon" fits this description as it refers to any shape with multiple straight sides, which can be of varying lengths and angles, therefore inclusive of both oblong (elongated rectangle) and square shapes
